statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 0 \\ -2 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 1 \\ -5 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 5 \\ 1 \\ -7 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 0 \\ 2 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^4

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ 0 \\ -2 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 1 \\ -5 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 5 \\ 1 \\ -7 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 0 \\ 2 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^4.
